Friends

  • class SMSUserSettings

Detailed Description

Create SMS(es) from given indata.

The type of phone etc. are considered during the formatting.

Definition at line 43 of file SMSFormatter.h.

uint32 SMSFormatter::calcSMSChoiceLength (  uint32  i,
SearchMatch *  vm,
SMSUserSettings *  smsUserFormat,
const char *  locationName
)  [static]
 

Calculate the length of one choice if written with SMSFormatter::writeSMSChoice(...).

Parameters:
i Choice number
vm Data for the match.
locationName Name of the location that the search was in.
smsUserFormat Formatting information.
Returns:
The number of characters written to data.

char* SMSFormatter::createNewPacket (  int32 &  smsNbr,
uint32 &  totalNbrOfSMSes,
bool  lastSMS,
bool  sendThisOne,
bool  bConcatenatedSMS,
const char *const   senderPhone,
const char *const   receiverPhone,
char *  data,
SMSSendRequest *  theRequest,
SMSUserSettings *  smsUserFormat
)  [static, private]
 

Create one SMSSendRequestPacket and add it to the given SMSSendRequest.

Parameters:
smsNbr What SMS in order. This variable is increased by one for each call.
totalNbrOfSMSes The number of SMS that are linked together.
lastSMS true if this is the last sms.
sendThisOne true if this sms is finished and should be sent. false if it's not done yet?
senderPhone Phonenumber of the sender.
receiverPhone Phonenumber of the receiver of the SMS.
data Pointer to the datafield where the content in the SMS is. This must be NULL-terminated!
theRequest The request where to add the new SMSSendRequestPacket (that is created in this method).
eol How end of line should be written.
messageID SMSMessageid (is 0 now)
operationType Type of operation
operationDescription String describing the operation
language The language of the message text.
Returns:
Pointer to a NULL-terminated databuffer that should be used as the begining of the next SMS.

)  [static]
 

Write a route to SMS(es).

Parameters:

senderPhone Phonenumber of the sender.
receiverPhone Phonenumber of the receiver.
requestID ID of the created request.
smsUserFormat The format for the telephone.
language The language of the message text.
Returns:
A SMSSendRequest with one or more SMSSendRequestPackets. If something went wrong, NULL is returned.

SMSSendRequest* SMSFormatter::makeTextSMSRequest (  const CellularPhoneModel *  cellular,
uint32  requestID,
const char *  userPhone,
const char *  serverPhone,
uint32  nbrStrings,
bool  lineBreak,
  ...
)  [static]
 

Make a single SMS from a number of strings with optional linebreak between them.

If all the strings doesn't fit into the SMS they are silently left out of the SMS.

Parameters:
cellular The CellularPhoneModel to get formating settings from.
nbrStrings The number of strings in function call.
lineBreak If there should be linebreaks between strings.
... nbrStrings strings. Assumend to be const char*.
Returns:
A SMSSendRequest with the SMSSendRequestPacket containing the strings.

SMSSendRequest* SMSFormatter::makeTextSMSRequest (  const UserCellular *  cellular,
uint32  requestID,
const char *  userPhone,
const char *  serverPhone,
uint32  nbrStrings,
bool  lineBreak,
  ...
)  [static]
 

Make a single SMS from a number of strings with optional linebreak between them.

If all the strings doesn't fit into the SMS they are silently left out of the SMS.

Parameters:
cellular The UserCellular to get formating settings from.
nbrStrings The number of strings in function call.
lineBreak If there should be linebreaks between strings.
... nbrStrings strings. Assumend to be const char*.
Returns:
A SMSSendRequest with the SMSSendRequestPacket containing the strings.

void SMSFormatter::newSMSString (  char *&  dest,
uint32 &  strLen,
const char *  src,
SMSUserSettings *  smsUserFormat
)  [static]
 

Creates and copies the source string to another string.

The string will be terminated with the correct eol.

Parameters:
dest The destination string.
strLen The length of the copied data (including eol).
src The source string.
smsUserFormat The format of the user terminal.
language The language of error messages.

uint32 SMSFormatter::printSMSString (  char *const   dest,
const char *const   src,
StringTable::languageCode  language,
UserConstants::EOLType  eol,
uint32  phoneWidth,
uint32  offsetOnFirstLine = 0,
uint32  maxNbrLines = MAX_UINT32,
bool  newLineAfterString = true
)  [static]
 

Print one string (NULL-terminated) into another, formatted according to the given parameters.

This method might be used by the other formatting methods in this class as well as by other classes.

Parameters:
dest String where the result is written.
src String containing the information that should be written correctly formatted to dest.
language The language of the string text if error.
eol The type of end of line for the receivers telephone.
phoneWidth The number of characters of the receivers deisplay.
offetOnFirstLine Default value is 0.
maxNbrLines The maximum number of lines (if the result does not fit it is truncated). If less than one then the needed number of lines are used. Default value is MAX_UINT32.
newLineAfterString True if the string shouls end with eol, false otherwise. Dafault value is true.
Returns:
The number of characters written to the dest string dest.

void SMSFormatter::setSMSUserSettingsFromCellularPhoneModel (  SMSUserSettings *  smsUserFormat,
CellularPhoneModel *  model,
StringTable::languageCode  lang
)  [static]
 

Gets the sms user settings from a CellularPhoneModel and sets it in a SMSUserSettings.

Parameters:
smsUserFormat The SMSUserSettings to fill in.
model The CellularPhoneModel to get settings from.
lang The prefered language.

uint32 SMSFormatter::writeEol (  char *  dest,
uint32  pos,
UserConstants::EOLType  eol,
uint32  charsLeftOnLine
)  [static, private]
 

Write end of line to a string.

The format and the number of characters required depends on the phonetype (the EOLType parameter given to this method).

Parameters:
dest The destination databuffer.
pos The position of the first character to write to dest (e.g the first character is written to dest[pos]).
eol What end of line type the receivers telephone have.
charsLeftOnLine The number of characters left on the current line. Needed if the phone does not recognize any new line character and must be padded with spaces.
Returns:
The number of characters written to dest.

uint32 SMSFormatter::writeSMSChoice (  uint32  i,
SearchMatch *  vm,
const char *  locationName,
char *  data,
SMSUserSettings *  smsUserFormat
)  [static]
 

Write one choice to a databuffer, formatted for an SMS.

Parameters:
i Choice number
vm Data for the match.
locationName Name of the location that the search was in.
data Where to write the choice.
smsUserFormat The formatting information.
Returns:
The number of characters written to data.
